newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan nuclear reactor Fugen to restart Thursday.
newsitem.headline: Japan nuclear reactor Fugen to restart Thursday.

text.p: Japan's "Fugen" prototype reactor will resume operations at 6 p.m. (0900 GMT) on Thursday, a spokesman for the reactor operator said.
It has been shut since April after plant officials failed to report an accident promptly.

"We plan to restart the unit at 6 o'clock this afternoon and power generation will start at around 2 p.m. (0500 GMT) tomorrow," said the spokesman for the operator, the Power Reactor and Nuclear Fuel Development Corp (PNC).

On April 15 the government ordered PNC to halt operations at the 165,000-kilowatt reactor on the Sea of Japan coast after learning that the state-run firm had waited 30 hours before reporting a radiation leak at the plant which occurred the previous day.
The Science and Technology Agency on Tuesday approved the restart of the unit after the PNC submitted a report to the agency saying it would take steps to improve the flow of information.
The reactor is scheduled for routine maintenance checks starting in early to mid-August, and PNC will bring it back on line in early November, he said.
The unit supplies electricity to three regional power utilities -- Kansai Electric Power Co Inc, Chubu Electric Power Co Inc and Hokuriku Electric Power Co Inc.
